summary: When creating a schedule with triggerImmediately: true, the initial run ignores the schedule's overlap policy and always uses AllowAll, causing subsequent runs to execute immediately instead of being buffered according to the configured policy.
userImpact: Users cannot reliably enforce overlap policies when immediately triggering schedules, potentially causing concurrent workflow executions when buffering was intended.
rootCause: The initial schedule run triggered via triggerImmediately always uses a default AllowAll overlap policy instead of inheriting the schedule's configured overlap policy.
proposedFix: Make triggerImmediately honor the schedule's overlap policy (e.g., BUFFER_ONE) for the initial run instead of defaulting to AllowAll.
workaround: Create the schedule without triggerImmediately, then manually call schedule.trigger() with the desired overlap policy.
keyQuote: triggerImmediately: true should honor the schedule's overlap policy instead of defaulting to the AllowAll policy
